medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 53 with forgetfulness and unsteady gait, urinary incontinence appeared at age 52. The patient experienced tripping and fell, resulting in a clavicle fracture. Neurologic examination revealed cognitive impairment, hyperreflexia, and bilateral cerebellar ataxia. Symptoms progressed, requiring follow-up assessments.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a food shop proprietor and had chronic exposure to pyrethroid insecticides over three years.
